business.headline: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

10 income tax changes in 2024: What you need to know for filing ITR in 2025The 2024 income tax reforms introduce revised tax slabs, higher deductions, and simplified TDS and capital gains rules, making tax filing easier and offering potential savings.

Bumper stock market debut for Mamata Machinery: Should you book profit or wait? Mamata Machinery stock market listing: A 147% premium debut for Mamata Machinery leaves investors wondering: Is this the peak, or should they hold on?

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong market debut: Is it a long-term bet?DAM Capital Advisors market listing: The listing matched market predictions, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had anticipated a 40%-50% premium, driven by robust demand and positive sentiment.

Sanathan Textiles shares list at 31% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Sanathan Textiles stock market debut: The listing comes after the company's initial public offering (IPO) witnessed robust demand, with subscriptions exceeding 36 times the total shares on offer.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price is down 50% on some trading apps todayMazagon Dock stock price: Certain trading apps may be displaying the unadjusted previous closing price, leading to the perception of a 50% fall. Adjusted for the split, Mazagon Dock shares were trading 2.13% lower on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:09 am.

Transrail Lighting shares list at 36% premium on Dalal Street debut Transrail Lighting share price: The shares opened at Rs 585.15 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The market debut aligns with market expectations, which was oversubscribed by 81 times.

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong debut, shares list at 39% premium DAM Capital Advisors listing: On the BSE, the shares began trading at Rs 392.90, marking a 38.83% premium compared to the issue price.

Mamata Machinery shares make bumper debut with 147% premium over IPO priceMamata Machinery listing: Shares of Mamata Machinery made a bumper debut and listed at Rs 600 per share on the NSE, a lot higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 243 per share.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as auto stocks fuel early rally; Tata Motors up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 323.12 points to 78,795.60, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 101.95 points to 23,852.15 as of 9:44 AM.

Dam Capital to Mamata Machinery: GMPs of 5 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayThese initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 19 and closed on December 23, collectively raised over Rs 2,900 crore.

Manmohan Singh's key reforms that shaped Indian economyDr Manmohan Singh's tenure as Finance Minister in the early 1990s and later as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 introduced policies that continue to influence India's growth.

Gautam Adani on work-life balance: Spend at least 4 hours with familyChairperson of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, shared his take on work-life balance and said one must try to spend at least four hours with their families.

Government may consider tax relief for income of up to Rs 10.50 lakh: ReportThe move, likely to be announced in the upcoming Budget 2025 on February 1, aims to boost consumption and address concerns over rising living costs amid a slowing economy.

Banks can charge over 30% interest on credit card dues. What it means for youThe Supreme Court has ruled that banks charging high credit card interest rates is lawful, placing responsibility on consumers to manage dues efficiently.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: I was in jail, Manmohan offered to pay tuition fees for my kids: Malaysian PMEven as leaders from across the world shared messages to condole the death of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, an anecdote posted by Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim revealed the lesser-known side of the Indian leader. That was an offer of help when Ibrahim was in jail that could have antagonised the Malaysian regime of that time.

Dark skies, bitter cold after heavy rain; hailstorm alert issued for North IndiaAn 'orange' warning was issued in Delhi after rain lashed several parts of the national capital and adjoining areas on Friday. The rain is expected to continue in the city.

Angry Virat Kohli confronts booing MCG fans, calmed by security officerIND vs AUS: Angry Virat Kohli nearly confronted booing fans on Day 2 of the Melbourne Test match. The incident occurred when Kohli was walking back to the pavilion after getting out.

Mumbai terror attack plotter Abdul Rehman Makki dies in PakistanAbdul Rehman Makki had been ill for the past few days and was undergoing treatment for high sugar levels at a private hospital in Lahore. He died on Friday after suffering a heart attack.

From Pakistan, with love: When Manmohan Singh reunited with childhood friendIn 2008, Manmohan Singh's childhood friend Raja Mohammad Ali travelled to Delhi from Pakistan to reconnect with the then Indian Prime Minister. Their emotional reunion was marked by heartfelt gestures.

Annamalai flogs himself as pledged, says he chose to surrender to 'higher power'K Annamalai, as promised, flogged himself six times outside his residence in Coimbatore in the presence of mediapersons and BJP supporters. He said he chose to perform this "tough ritual" to protest against the "continued injustice" in the state.
Tollywood gets the message that Telangana government is the real 'fire'What is clear is that the message about who is the real boss, the real 'fire', has been conveyed loud and clear to the industry.

When Manmohan Singh, India's first Sikh PM, apologised for 1984 anti-Sikh riotsManmohan Singh's apology for the 1984 anti-Sikh riots marked a rare moment of political courage, as he sought to heal wounds inflicted on the Sikh community during Congress rule. The act of statesmanship in 2005 after the Nanavati Commission report stood in contrast to the silence of the Gandhi family.

RRR Behind and Beyond review: A dazzling tribute, but low on technical nuances Released-Fri Dec 27, 2024RRR Behind and Beyond review: A visually engaging yet somewhat generic documentary that celebrates the making of SS Rajamouli's magnum opus, RRR, starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan. However, the show hardly focusses on the technical front.

Vivek Ramaswamy says American parents raising their kids wrongTrump supporters are demanding an H-1B freeze but American entrepreneur and politician, Vivek Ramaswamy, has a cultural diagnosis for the country's STEM shortfall. He says American parents are raising their kids wrong.

When Manmohan Singh opened up on 2G case, reinstating A Raja as ministerManmohan Singh, in an interview with India Today, shed light on his exchange with then-Telecom Minister A Raja over the 2G spectrum case and why he chose to retain him in his Cabinet.

How 30 minutes of madness spoilt Virat-Yashasvi's hard-work on Day 2A late batting collapse in the final session of Day 2 spoilt all the hard work done by Yashasvi Jaiswal and Virat Kohli during their 102-run stand for the third wicket. India were 164 for 5 against Australia on day two of the fourth Test on Friday.

Inside Salman Khan's birthday bash: Actor cuts cake with niece Ayat, family joins inSalman Khan turned 59 on December 27. An inside video of the actor's midnight celebration has emerged online. Salman shares his birthday with his niece Ayat.
8 dead, many injured after bus falls off bridge into drain in Punjab's BathindaThe accident happened on Kot Shamir Road in Bathinda, when the bus fell into the drain while crossing a bridge.

Manmohan Singh: The 'accidental' Prime Minister who transformed IndiaFrom a small village in undivided Punjab to Cambridge University and the corridors of power in New Delhi, Dr. Manmohan Singh's journey is nothing short of extraordinary.

ED lens on Union Minister Chirag Paswan's aide, simultaneous raids in 3 citiesThe ED is conducting raids at multiple locations associated with Hulas Pandey, a former Bihar legislator and a prominent leader of the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) led by Union Minister Chirag Paswan.

Emotional post by US CEO leads to Rs 3.4 crore crypto fund for daughter's treatmentSiqui Chen, co-founder of Runway Financial, shared the devastating news of his daughter's diagnosis with a rare brain tumor in a post on December 25.

How Manmohan Singh pulled India from brink of economic deathThrough path-breaking reforms in the 1991 Budget, focused on liberalisation and privatisation, Manmohan Singh opened up India's economy. Here is what India Today reported on his economic reforms.

German President dissolves parliament, calls for snap elections on February 23The president, whose post has been largely ceremonial in the post-war era, also called for the election campaign to be conducted fairly and transparently.

Renting wedding lehenga is practical, but why are Indian brides still not up for itPractical, sustainable, and hassle-free, renting a wedding lehenga seems perfect in theory. Yet, it remains far from becoming a mainstream choice among Indian brides.

Scared I'd never make it home: Srishty Rode on her battle with pneumonia in EuropeTV actor Srishty Rode revealed her battle with pneumonia during her Europe trip, sharing how it affected her health and her journey back to India. Despite the challenges, she remains hopeful and is focused on her recovery.

Is Sheikh Hasina's prolonged stay India's liability or leverage?New Delhi has declined comment on Dhaka's note verbale to extradite the former Bangladesh PM, who is wanted back home for alleged crimes against humanity

This is my car: Manmohan Singh's fondness for Maruti 800 over BMW meant for PMsSpeaking to Aaj Tak a day after Dr Manmohan Singh died, aged 92, Asim Arun narrated how the former PM would often gaze longingly at his Maruti 800, which remained parked behind the official motorcade's gleaming BMW at the Prime Minister's residence.

Manmohan Singh trusted old-school FDs to grow his wealthManmohan Singh, India's former Prime Minister who liberalised the country's economy as the finance minister in 1991, passed away on Thursday. This is how Singh, an ace economist, grew his wealth through traditional investment instruments like fixed deposits, by disciplined reinvestment.

Zayed Khan's net worth: Main Hoon Na actor richer than Allu Arjun, Ranbir KapoorActor Zayed Khan who rose to fame with Main Hoon Na, has reinvented himself as a prosperous businessman. Today, with a net worth estimated at Rs 1500 crore, he has surpassed stars like Allu Arjun, Prabhas, and Ranbir Kapoor.

Doctors review: An unfiltered glimpse into the lives behind white coatsReleased-Fri Dec 27, 2024Doctors review: The makers of the Sharad Kelkar and Harleen Sethi-led show have done justice to stitching together the personal and professional lives of doctors. They have handled the medical side of the stories well.
Watch: Salman Khan clicked at Kalina airport todayBollywood superstar Salman Khan, who turns 59 today, was clicked at the Kalina airport today. The actor arrived at the airport amid heavy security.

Parineeti Chopra's photo dump: 'Soul healing' with Raghav Chadha amid Goa shootActor Parineeti Chopra shared her December photo dump while showing how she did 'soul healing' with hubby Raghav Chadha in the simplest way ever. Take a look at the pictures here.

sports.headline: Who is to blame for Yashasvi Jaiswal-Virat Kohli MCG mix-up? Pundits weigh inFormer cricketers Sunil Gavaskar and Justin Langer have shared their opinion on Virat Kohli-Yashasvi Jaiswal run out on Day 2 of the fourth Test between India and Australia in Melbourne.

Feels like grade cricket: Nathan Lyon reveals Sam Konstas' debut verdict vs IndiaAt just 19, Sam Konstas stole the spotlight with a fearless 60 on his Boxing Day Test debut. Calm under pressure, the youngest Aussie in decades to hit fifty-plus showed why he's a star in the making.

Rohit Sharma's Test career nearing its end? Mark Waugh fears so after MCG flopshowFormer Australia cricketer Mark Waugh feels India captain Rohit Sharma's career is certainly coming to an end if he doesn't do anything in the remaining matches of the ongoing series against Australia.

SA vs PAK: Babar Azam imitates Mohammed Siraj with Stuart Broad bail flipBabar Azam adds a playful twist to the Centurion Test, joining cricket's growing bail-switch trend. Following in the footsteps of Stuart Broad and Mohammed Siraj, his light-hearted move reflects the superstitions and humour in the intense world of Test cricket.

Age making Rohit Sharma slower: Gavaskar decodes India skipper's strugglesRohit Sharma's struggles continued in the Melbourne Test as Sunil Gavaskar critiqued his slowness, attributing it to age. India's batting collapse left them trailing by 310 runs, with hopes pinned on Pant and Jadeja for a recovery.

When Steve Smith feared a Virat Kohli masterclass in MelbourneAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Virat Kohli looked in complete control of his game, resisting the temptation to drive and poke at deliveries bowled in the corridor of uncertainty. However, he fell into the trap, getting out to Scott Boland in the last hour of the day's play on Saturday.

Deepti Sharma's record 6-wicket haul helps India clean-sweep West IndiesDeepti Sharma's record-breaking six-wicket haul powered India to a clean sweep against West Indies. With stellar bowling and unbeaten runs, Deepti showcased her all-round brilliance, setting the stage for India's preparation for the ODI World Cup 2025.

Watch: Virat Kohli booed by Melbourne crowd, India star not happyAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Virat Kohli confronted a section of Melbourne Cricket Ground fans after they booed the batter. Kohli, who was heading into the tunnel after getting out for 36, turned back and stared at the unruly fans.

Got to have faith: Steve Smith highlights mantra that led to Melbourne 100Australia batter Steve Smith emphasised the importance of faith in his abilities, which he credited as his mantra leading up to his match-defining knock of 140 against India in the fourth Test in Melbourne. Smith acknowledged that his batting success in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy also benefited from a certain element of luck.

Picked for MCG Test as batter? Washington Sundar reveals Team India messagingAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Washington Sundar was asked whether the team management was viewing him more as a batter than a bowler after he replaced Shubman Gill in the XI. The all-rounder expressed his excitement about the team backing him to excel in all three facets of the game—batting, bowling, and fielding. Sundar also shared insights about the inputs he received from R Ashwin ahead of the Melbourne Test.

Kohli faced scrutiny after an altercation with Sam Konstas and a privacy breach at Melbourne airport involving his family.

Drop underperforming Siraj, be brutally upfront with him: Sunil Gavaskar Australia vs India, 4th Test: Not a big fan of resting players in big-ticket series, Sunil Gavaskar urged the Indian team management to be 'brutally honest' with their feedback to Mohammed Siraj and drop him for not performing up to expectations.

Rohit disturbed the openers in Melbourne: Manjrekar on India batting orderSanjay Manjrekar criticised Rohit Sharma's decision to open in Melbourne, highlighting its disruptive impact on India's batting lineup during the fourth Test against Australia, leaving India trailing after repeated batting collapses against a formidable Australian attack.

4th Test: Late Yashasvi, Virat Kohli blows sink India after horror bowling show at MCGAustralia vs India, 4th Test: India conceded control after a late collapse, triggered by Yashasvi Jaiswal's run-out in the last hour of play on Friday. After having been horrible with the ball, India lost momentum with the bat to fall behind in Melbourne.

Yashasvi Jaiswal run out for 82 after terrible mix-up with Virat Kohli on Day 2AUS vs IND, Boxing Day Test: Young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal was run out for 82 after a terrible mix-up with senior partner Virat Kohli in the final session of Day 2 at the MCG. Jaiswal missed a well-deserved hundred at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

What did you do wrong? Nathan Lyon sledges KL Rahul after batting order changeIND vs AUS: Australia spinner Nathan Lyon sledged KL Rahul after the batter came out at No.3 during India's batting innings at the MCG. Lyon jokingly asked what did Rahul do wrong to be shifted down to No.3 in the batting order.

Rohit Sharma's captaincy pathetic: Ex-selector tears into India skipperBorder Gavaskar Trophy: Former India chief selector MSK Prasad has slammed Rohit Sharma's captaincy in the ongoing Boxing Day Test against Australia.

Sunil Gavaskar defends Virat Kohli's fine: Can't hang a man for picking a pocketAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Sunil Gavaskar said the International Cricket Council did not do Virat Kohli any favours by handing him a 20 per cent fine for shouldering Sam Konstas on Boxing Day. Several former Australian cricketers accused the ICC of being lenient towards Kohli, calling for a harsher punishment.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
